title: theBalancedBriefNLtech

items.title: US cargo tech company publicly exposed its shipping systems and customer data to the web
items.description: Shipping tech company Bluspark left internal plaintext passwords, including those of executives, exposed to the internet, at a time when hacks in the ...

items.title: How AI Companies Got Caught Up in US Military Efforts
items.description: Two years ago, companies like Meta and OpenAI were united against military use of their tools. Now all of that has changed.

items.title: The Merach Vibration Plate Is the Funniest Workout I've Ever Done

items.title: Tesla will only offer subscriptions for Full Self-Driving (Supervised) going forward
items.description: It's a huge change to Tesla's approach with FSD, and it could impact Musk's $1T pay package and the company's myriad legal troubles.

items.title: YouTube now has a way for parents to block kids from watching Shorts
items.description: Parents will be able to toggle the Shorts time limit on connected children's accounts.

items.title: Gemini’s new beta feature provides proactive responses based on your photos, emails, and more
